glsa.title: Streamripper: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple buffer overflows have been discovered in Streamripper, allowing for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Streamripper is a tool for extracting and recording mp3 files from a Shoutcast stream.

description.p: Stefan Cornelius from Secunia Research reported multiple buffer overflows in the http_parse_sc_header(), http_get_pls() and http_get_m3u() functions in lib/http.c when parsing overly long HTTP headers, or pls and m3u playlists with overly long entries.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a malicious server, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
